text.0:
You can support our program teaching Americans of all ages how to sort fact from fiction by donating to the nonpartisan, nonprofit institute we’re a part of >>> @Poynter. 

https://t.co/gPtyY2Sleq
text.1:
When we learn how to spot disinformation or search for fuller context, we’re working towards a shared set of facts that will rebuild the foundation of our democracy.

If you want to join us in this critical work, check out more info on MediaWise here:backhand_index_pointing_down::backhand_index_pointing_down:
https://t.co/d1gR6XBihE
text.2:
Our country is worse off without agreed upon facts. 

“Without this common narrative, democracy becomes very tough,” Obama said. 

It’s essential we learn digital media literacy skills. That’s why we’re here.
text.4: Attn Teens: Check out this opportunity from @mediawise! Join their Teen Fact-Checking Network and get involved in #medialiteracy. https://t.co/kaMJq5OlN4
text.5:
The largest global fact-checking collab ever is about to get even bigger! 

The @ParisPeaceForum is scaling up @factchecknet’s #CoronavirusFacts Alliance.

As an IFCN ally, we can’t wait to see our COVID fact-checks get to more people. Congrats, IFCN!:partying_face:
https://t.co/Vd0i0QbLxR
text.6: Students: Want to be an expert teen fact checker? Apply to this opp with our friends at @MediaWise: https://t.co/FT3jUCkxYO
